frameDefinitions: An Item is detached from a Source, or Items are detached from each other.
This frame contains nouns denoting Aggregates of Individuals.
A recordable sequence of events is associated with a given Topic.
This scenario describes a series of Events, associated with a single Participant, i.e., the history of the Participant.
A Text is an entity that contains linguistic, symbolic information on a Topic, created by an Author at the Time_of_creation.
An Entity has ceased to exist.
frameExamples: When the snow plow is <t>disconnected</t> from the vehicle, extend the lift cylinder to the end of its stroke and coat the chrome rod with a light grease.
An <t><fex name='Agg'>army</fex></t> of postal workers descended on my office.
And that is where the <t>history</t> of art begins.
We've been worried about our recent hire's <t><fex name='Events'>history</fex></t> of deceiving employers.
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Item</fen> identifies the entity that is detached from a <fen>Source</fen>.
<fen>Items</fen> identifies the plural items that are detached from each other.
<fen>Source</fen> identifies the location from which the <fen>Item</fen>(s) is detached.
This role identifies the people or things that form  the <fen>Aggregate</fen>.
This role identifies the collection of entities that are the <fen>Aggregate</fen>.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject about which the history is given.
When the events concerning the <fen>Topic</fen> occured.

The <fen>Participant</fen> is either an active participant in all of the <fen>Events</fen> (e.g., Agent or Patient), or is more peripherally associated with the <fen>Events</fen> (e.g., Location or Topic).
The <fen>Events</fen> which the <fen>Participant</fen> is a part of. This role is used to mark the frame-evoking element.
The <fen>Text</fen> is the entity that contains linguistic information. This an incorporated role for each LU in this frame.
The region where the <fen>Text</fen> is sold, circulated, or otherwise popular.
Concrete or abstract entity that does not exist after the event.
A point at which the <fen>Entity</fen> (saliently) does not exist.
This is the Place where the <fen>Entity</fen> (saliently) does not exist.
listRoleExamples: I feel like <fex>my head</fex> is detached from the rest of my body.
<fex>The neck vertebrae</fex> are unfused in rorquals and gray whales, which allows for some flexibility at the head and neck.
The toilet is loose <fex>from the floor</fex> and must be repaired.
A crowd <fex>of hoodlums</fex> filled the plaza.
A <fex><t>crowd</t></fex> of hoodlums filled the plaza.
The role of the Byzantine Empire in <fex>European</fex> history is not understood by all.
We've been worried about <fex>our recent hire's</fex> history of deceiving employers.
We will focus on events in her recent <fex>history</fex>.
